result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy D House Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **Court will authorize transfer of Probation to Jefferson County**

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
*05/18/2022 COURT MODIFIES COSTS. STANDARD COURT COSTS ARE WAIVED. DEFENDANT TO PAY DNA SURCHARGE AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol or drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

05/18/2022 PER RESTITUTION HEARING. RESTITUTION DETERMINED FOR Waukesha County Risk Management AS: $1,782.00 for case 22CM174; $456.00 for case 22CM241; $581.00 for case 22CM073. Restitution to be paid as a condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - Court grants 77 days credit. TIME SERVED

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Stacy D House in court, in custody (by zoom from Jefferson County Jail) and attorney John Marchan.

Defense is not contesting the amounts of restitution requested - Only issue is ability to pay.

Defendant was sworn in and testified as to his ability to pay.

Court finds the defendant has the ability to pay.
Reasons placed on the record.
Court will order the following restitution:
Breakdown:
$1,782 - To case 22CM174
$456  - To case 22CM241
$581 -  To case 22CM73
Total:  $2,819
To be paid to Waukesha County Risk Management as a Condition of the Sentence.
Court will also waive all costs on this case and only impose the DNA Surcharge.
Amended JOC to be prepared.
Restitution hearing on May 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Stacy D House in court, in custody, by video from Jefferson County Jail.  Attorney John Paul Marchan in court for Defendant Stacy D House. Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

Case was set for restitution hearing. Atty Marchan advises that he has not had an opportinity to review new filings with his client as he is in custody. Atty Marchan requests to adjourn matter until a date after his client is released on 05/26.   

Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office, and victim appeared in person in court. 

Court will reset restitution hearing. Defendant may appear by video.  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for May 2, 2022.

Requesting the court adjournment the restitution scheduled for tomorrow, 04/28/22, due to the defendant being in custody in Jefferson County Jail.

04/27/22 - Court Reviewed - Request Denied - Video has been set up with Jefferson County Jail to address the restitution hearing.

addressed to: Stacy D House Jr for hearing on 04/28/22

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Restitution hearing on April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:20 PM  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Stacy D House in court, in custody, with attorney John Paul Marchan.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.  
Case called for plea and sentencing.  
State gives sentencing recommendations to the Court.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant.  
Defendant enters a guilty alford plea to count 1.  
Court finds the defendant guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Cases 22CM73, 22CM174, 22CM241 are dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following:

COUNT 1:

SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation: 2 YEARS
Court will authorize transfer of probation to Jefferson County.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.


RESTITUTION:  To be determined at a later date.  
COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 75 Days Jail. Court grants 77 Days credit- TIME SERVED.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.

Restitution hearing scheduled on April 28, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
